item.title: Initial Thoughts of Partial Differentiation
item.description: As a person who’ve only completed Calc 1 & 2, I just started learning some partial differentiation. The symbol of partial differentiaion is a bit confused to me at first, but there’s an easier way of thinking about differentiaion in 3-dimentional cases: cutting cakes. When you plan to cut a cake, you can either cut it in two ways: you can cut it from left to right, or from front to back.

item.title: Complex Numbers & Polar Coordinates
item.description: This is a complex number: $$z = x + iy$$ A complex number, as a combination of a real number ($x$) and an imagenary number ($iy$, or $yi$, it doesn’t matter) can be sketched with 2-dimentional axis. Note that $y$ is a real number, and $i$ is an imagenary number ($i = \sqrt{-1}$). This is an example from mathbits : The real axis represents the real number $x$, with each unit representing 1.
